description.narrative: Support to Economic Diversification and Inclusive Growth to Address the Challenges of Diversifying Sources of Economic Growth, Eradicate Poverty and Reduce Inequalities and Exclusion

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
# of knowledge products (bulletins, policy briefs) from the knowledge management system and South-South initiatives
Approved Botswana Poverty Eradication Policy & Strategy
# of policies, programmes and strategies revised to address context specific economic diversification and growth
# of SMEs participating in local supply chains

comment.narrative:
Economic Diversification Drive
Local Economic Development Policy Framework

Develop Decentralization Policy & Fiscal decentralization and Implementation Plan Completion of Poverty Eradication Strategy & Implementation Plan Revision of the EDD Medium to Long-term Strategy Revision of the Botswana Export Development Programme (BEDP) Revision of the Local Economic Development (LED) Project Conduct a Capacity Assessment for the Ministry of Investment Trade and industry (MITI) Development of the South-South Cooperation Strategy Rollout of the Supplier Development Programme (SDP) to the selected Value Chains

1. Decentralization Policy and Implementation Plan completed but still awaiting approval by Government. 2. Poverty Eradication Policy and Implementation Plan completed, still awaiting formal approval by Government. 3. Revision of the EDD Strategy ongoing, but completion has been delayed. 4. Revised Botswana Export Development Programme (BEDP) completed. 5. Revised Local Economic Development Framework has been completed. Four bankable business plans at different levels of implementation by respective districts. 6. Capacity assessment of the Ministry of Investment, Trade and Industry halted until Government has made a decision about the rationalization Government ministries and departments. 7. Development of the South-South and Triangular Cooperation ongoing and nearing completion. 8. Roll-out of the Supplier Development Programme has commenced.

Support to Department of International Trade: 1. Training of DIT Staff on Trade and Policy 2. Simplification of 3 trade agreements to enhance use and benefits to the private sector. The trade agreements are AGOA, SADC FTA and the SADC/EU EPA
Support to Doing Business Unit: 1. Conduct Phase 1 of the Regulatory Impact Assessment (RIA)
Support to Economic Diversification Drive Unit: - Development of the Revised EDD Strategy
Support to Botswana Investment Trade Centre - Complete Revised Botswana Exporter Development Programme
Office of the President - Poverty Eradication Unit: - Complete the National Multidimensional Poverty Index (MPI) for Botswana
Ministry of Local Government and Rural Development: - Develop MLGRD Strategy and Transformation Plan
Support to Ministry of International Affairs and Cooperation - Finalization of the Botswana South-South and Triangular Cooperation (SS&TrC) Strategy and Implementation Plan
Supplier Development Programme: - Develop COVID 19 Business continuity plan for SDP - Training of additional SDP consultants

Support to Department of International Trade: 1. DIT Staff trained on Trade and Policy 2. 3 trade agreements simplified to enhance use and benefits to the private sector. The agreements are, AGOA, SADC FTA and the SADC/EU EPA
Support to Doing Business Unit: 1. Phase 1 of the Regulatory Impact Assessment (RIA) has been completed. Several staff from government ministries and parastatal institutions have been trained on RIA and 2 pilot RIAs have been completed.
Support to Economic Diversification Drive Unit: The development of the Revised EDD Strategy is ongoing and is scheduled to be completed during the 1st quarter of 2021.
Support to Botswana Investment Trade Centre - Revised Botswana Exporter Development Programme (BEDP) has been completed and implementation has started in earnest.
Office of the President - Poverty Eradication Unit: - National Multidimensional Poverty Index (MPI) is due to be completed in December. Implementation will begin in 2021 with piloting of the MPI in the most poverty-stricken districts
Ministry of Local Government and Rural Development: - MLGRD Strategy and Transformation Plan has been completed. To facilitate implementation and alignment with the strategy, the 2021/22 Annual Plans and Budgets are to be developed drawing from the revised Strategy.
Support to Ministry of International Affairs and Cooperation - South-South and Triangular Cooperation (SS&TrC) Strategy has been completed. Draft Implementation Plan to accompany the strategy is in place (expected to the finalised and implemented in 2021).
Supplier Development Programme: - SDP implementation of the Supplier Development Methodology (SDM) continued during 2020 although at a reduced pace owing to COVID-19 and its attendant travel and meeting restrictions. - Additional SDP consultants have been trained to increase the number in order to increase the coverage in 2021.

Support to Department of International Trade: 1. Development of the Trade in Services Strategy 2. 3 more trade agreements simplified to enhance use and benefits to the private sector. The agreements are, AfCFTA; UK/SACU+Mozambique EPA; SACU/EFTA Agreement
Support to Doing Business Unit: 1. Conduct Phase 2 of the Regulatory Impact Assessment (RIA)
Support to Economic Diversification Drive Unit: 1. Complete the Development of the Revised EDD Strategy
Support to Botswana Investment Trade Centre 1. Undertake Study and Profile African Markets to Determine Realistic Export Opportunities for Botswana Under the AfCFTA
Office of the President - Poverty Eradication Unit: 1. Pilot the National Multidimensional Poverty Index (MPI) among selected districts and sub-districts with disproportionately higher levels of poverty.
Ministry of Local Government and Rural Development: 1. Review the Implementation of the Affirmative Action Framework (AAF) for Remote Area Communities. 2. Roll-out of Microsoft Dynamics Great Plains Modules and Capacity Building at Local Authorities 3. Undertake the Situational Analysis on the Current Fiscal Decentralization Practices and Develop a Fiscal Decentralization System and a Five-Year Roll-out Plan
Support to Ministry of International Affairs and Cooperation 1. Develop the Economic Diplomacy Strategy
Support to the Citizen Entrepreneurial Development Agency (CEDA)
1. Develop a Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) System for CEDA.
Support to Business Botswana 1. Develop and Implement a Sustainability Plan for the Market Intelligence Information System (MIIS) and the e-marketplace for the private sector

Support to Department of International Trade: 1. The Development of the Trade in Services Strategy is ongoing and is expected to be completed in the first quarter of 2022. 2. 3 more simplified trade agreements have been completed, making a total of 6 simplified trade agreements. The process of publicizing them among their intended users and beneficiaries has started.
Support to Doing Business Unit: 1. Phase 2 of the Regulatory Impact Assessment (RIA) is ongoing, albeit slowly due to the restrictiveness of COVID-19.
Support to Economic Diversification Drive Unit: 1. The Revised EDD Strategy is expected to be completed in the first quarter of 2022.
Support to Botswana Investment Trade Centre 1. Final Report of the Study and Profile African Markets to Determine Realistic Export Opportunities for Botswana Under the AfCFTA is expected to be completed in the first quarter of 2022.
Office of the President - Poverty Eradication Unit: 1. Pilot the National Multidimensional Poverty Index (MPI) is ongoing. One sub-district has been completed and work has started in other districts and sub-districts. More sub-districts will be added in 2022.
Ministry of Local Government and Rural Development: 1. Final Report of the Review the Implementation of the Affirmative Action Framework (AAF) for Remote Area Communities is due to be approved by the Technical Reference Group. 2. Roll-out of Microsoft Dynamics Great Plains Modules and Capacity Building at Local Authorities is ongoing. 3. Situational Analysis on the Current Fiscal Decentralization Practices and is expected to be completed in the first half of 2022.
Support to Ministry of International Affairs and Cooperation 1. Development of the Economic Diplomacy Strategy is ongoing is expected to be completed in the third quarter of 2022.
Support to the Citizen Entrepreneurial Development Agency (CEDA)
1. A Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) System had been developed for CEDA. It is awaiting approval by the Technical Reference Group.
Support to Business Botswana 1. Sustainability Plan for the Market Intelligence Information System (MIIS) and the e-marketplace for the private sector was developed and implemented. The implementation of the e-marketplace will now continue as part of Business Botswana business-as-usual activity.
